title: Task-Oriented 6-DoF Grasp Pose Detection in Clutters
author: An-Lan Wang (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Nuo Chen (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Kun-Yu Lin (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Yuan-Ming Li (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Wei-Shi Zheng (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University, Key Laboratory of Machine Intelligence and Advanced Computing, Ministry of Education, China), ...
relevance_why: The study of grasp pose detection, particularly in complex and cluttered environments, may inform techniques for audio source separation, where similar spatial reasoning could enhance auditory scene analysis.
background: Detecting suitable grasp poses for robots in cluttered environments to accomplish specific tasks like pouring or cutting.
contribution: This paper introduces the 6-DoF Task Grasp dataset and a novel One-Stage TaskGrasp model to solve the task-oriented grasp pose detection problem in cluttered scenes, achieving significant improvements in detection efficiency and accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically focus on single-object scenarios, employing two-stage pipelines that are time-consuming and less accurate in cluttered environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by implementing a one-stage detection method that directly selects grasp points and generates appropriate orientations based on specific tasks, reducing error accumulation and increasing overall efficiency.

key_innovation: The use of a task-oriented point selection strategy alongside a task-guided pose detection module to streamline the grasp detection process.
real_world_impact: The findings may lead to more efficient robotic assistance in domestic settings, optimizing the way robots interact with cluttered spaces during tasks.
limitations: Limited to grasp detection in simulated environments; real-world transferability not fully validated.

new_terms.6-DoF: **6 Degrees of Freedom** refers to the freedom of movement of a rigid body in three-dimensional space, which includes translation along and rotation about the x, y, and z axes.
new_terms.One-Stage TaskGrasp: **One-Stage TaskGrasp** is a novel model proposed for simultaneous task-oriented grasp pose detection and optimization in a single, efficient step.
